description: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the larynx. It is the most common histologic type of laryngeal carcinoma. It can arise from the glottis, supraglottic area, or it can be transglottic. Glottic squamous cell carcinoma is the most frequent laryngeal carcinoma in the United States. The symptoms, clinical behavior and the prognosis depend on the site of origin within the larynx.
name: laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma

hasExactSynonym: squamous cell carcinoma of the larynx

description: quantification of the wave-like oscillations in the beta band (13-30 Hz) of electric potential between parts of the brain
name: beta wave measurement

description: Is a quantification of the area of the optic cup
name: optic cup area measurement

description: Infection by hookworms of the genus Ancylostoma.
name: ancylostomiasis

description: quantification of the amount of plasma protease C1 inhibitor in a sample
name: plasma protease C1 inhibitor measurement

description: The determination of the ratio of hemoglobin D compared to total hemoglobin present in a sample. The measurement may be expressed as a ratio or percentage. [ NCI ]
name: Hemoglobin D to Total Hemoglobin Ratio Measurement

description: Quantification of the energy intake of an individual, e.g. based on a food frequency questionnaire or seven-day food record and assessment of the calorific content of the food types and portion sizes recorded.
name: energy intake measurement

description: A deviation from the normal odor of the vaginal discharge.
name: abnormal vaginal discharge smell

description: Quantification of the presence or severity of an allergy to beta-lactam, including beta-lactam antibiotics.
name: beta-lactam allergy measurement

description: Quantification of the amount of the amino acid histidine in a sample.
name: histidine measurement

description: Quantification of the amount of leukocyte esterase present in a sample.
name: leukocyte esterase measurement

description: An autosomal recessive disorder characterized by severe infantile inflammatory bowel disease manifesting as bloody diarrhea and failure to thrive, global developmental delay, epilepsy, brain atrophy and encephalopathy. Affected individuals suffer from recurrent infections associated with impaired T-cell response to stimulation and decreased T-cell subsets, including regulatory and helper T cells.
name: inflammatory bowel disease, immunodeficiency, and encephalopathy

description: The quantification of cholesteryl ester 20:5 levels in a sample.
name: cholesteryl ester 20:5 measurement

description: Quantification of the severity of the symptoms of pneumonia, an inflammation of the lung parenchyma caused by an infection.
name: pneumonia severity measurement

description: The determination of the amount of allograft inflammatory factor 1 in a sample
name: allograft inflammatory factor 1 measurement

description: The determination of the amount of immunoglobulin G in a sample
name: immunoglobulin G measurement

description: The determination of the amount of neural cell adhesion molecule l1-like protein in a sample
name: neural cell adhesion molecule l1-like protein measurement

description: The determination of the amount of protein amnionless in a sample
name: protein amnionless measurement

description: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the nasopharynx.
name: nasopharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma

description: A neoplasm of low malignant potential arising from the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of neoplastic transitional cells with atypical or malignant features without evidence of stromal invasion.
name: Borderline Ovarian Brenner Tumor

description: A malignant epithelial neoplasm characterized by a papillary growth pattern. A papillary carcinoma may be composed of glandular cells (papillary adenocarcinoma), squamous cells (papillary squamous cell carcinoma), or transitional cells (papillary transitional cell carcinoma). Bladder carcinoma is a representative example of papillary transitional cell carcinoma.
name: papillary carcinoma

description: Death of cells in the KIDNEY CORTEX, a common final result of various renal injuries including HYPOXIA; ISCHEMIA; and drug toxicity.
name: kidney cortex necrosis

description: A serious condition in which a newborn breathes a mixture of meconium (the first intestinal discharge) and amniotic fluid into the lungs around the time of delivery. Meconium aspiration syndrome occurs in 5-10 percent of births and typically occurs when the infant is stressed, as when the infant is past its due date.
name: meconium aspiration syndrome

description: A syndrome characterized by retropatellar or peripatellar pain resulting from physical and biochemical changes in the patellofemoral joint. The pain is most prominent when ascending or descending stairs, squatting, or sitting with flexed knees. There is a lack of consensus on the etiology and treatment. The syndrome is often confused with (or accompanied by) chondromalacia patellae, the latter describing a pathological condition of the cartilage and not a syndrome.
name: patellofemoral pain syndrome

description: A disease of the PITUITARY GLAND characterized by the excess amount of ADRENOCORTICOTROPIC HORMONE secreted. This leads to hypersecretion of cortisol (HYDROCORTISONE) by the ADRENAL GLANDS resulting in CUSHING SYNDROME.
name: pituitary-dependent Cushing's disease

description: A common, often “silent” liver disease. It resembles alcoholic liver disease, but occurs in people who drink little or no alcohol. The major feature in NASH is fat in the liver, along with inflammation and damage.
name: non-alcoholic steatohepatitis

description: A subtype of MICROSCOPIC COLITIS, characterized by chronic watery DIARRHEA of unknown origin, a normal COLONOSCOPY but abnormal histopathology on BIOPSY. Microscopic examination of biopsy samples taken from the COLON show larger-than-normal band of subepithelial COLLAGEN.
name: collagenous colitis

description: Disorders that are causes by overuse of tendons.
name: Tendinopathy

description: A carcinoma that arises from epithelial cells of the colon
name: colon carcinoma
Benign paroxysmal tonic upgaze of childhood with ataxia

description: Orofaciodigital syndrome type 11 is an extremely rare, sporadic form of Orofaciodigital syndrome (OFDS; see this term) with only a few reported cases, and characterized by facial (blepharophimosis, bulbous nasal tip, broad nasal bridge, downslanting palpebral fissures and low set ears) and skeletal (post-axial polydactyly and fusion of vertebrae) malformations along with severe intellectual disability, deafness and congenital heart defects.
name: Orofaciodigital syndrome type 11

description: A corneal disease involving changes of the cornea to a cone shape and resulting in progressive thinning of the cornea. This may result in blurry vision, double vision, nearsightedness, astigmatism, and light sensitivity. In more severe cases a scarring or a circle may be seen within the cornea.
name: Keratoconus

description: Juvenile absence epilepsy is one of the age-related idiopathic generalized epilepsies (IGE) with an age at onset between 10 and 17 years of age, and is characterized by sporadic (non-pyknoleptic) occurrence of absence seizures frequently associated with generalized tonic-clonic seizures (GTCS) predominantly on awakening. Interictal and ictal EEG shows generalized spike and wave discharges with normal background activity.
name: Juvenile absence epilepsy

description: Rare hereditary hemochromatosis comprises the rare forms of hereditary hemochromatosis (HH), a group of diseases characterized by excessive tissue iron deposition. These rare forms are hemochromatosis type 2 (juvenile), type 3 (TFR2-related), and type 4 (ferroportin disease) (see these terms). Hemochromatosis type 1 (also called classic hemochromatosis; see this term) is not a rare disease.
name: Rare hereditary hemochromatosis

description: Hemoglobin C - beta-thalassemia (HbC - BT) is a form of beta-thalassemia (see this term) resulting in moderate hemolytic anemia.
name: Hemoglobin C - beta-thalassemia

description: the quantification of psychosocial stress factors such as financial strain, marital problems, work-related difficulties or health problems, usually assessed through self-reporting via standardised questionnaires.
name: psychosocial stress measurement

description: Infection with nematodes of the genus ascaridia. This condition usually occurs in fowl, often manifesting diarrhea.
name: ascaridiasis

description: A microsporidiosis that is a zoonotic infectious disease results_in disseminated fungal infection in dogs, cats, hamsters, guinea pigs, rats, mice and humans, has_material_basis_in Encephalitozoon cuniculi, has_material_basis_in Encephalitozoon intestinalis or has_material_basis_in Encephalitozoon hellem.
name: encephalitozoonosis

description: A severe condition resulting from bacteria invading healthy muscle from adjacent traumatized muscle or soft tissue. The infection originates in a wound contaminated with bacteria of the genus clostridium. C. perfringens accounts for the majority of cases (over eighty percent), while C. noyvi, C. septicum, and C. histolyticum cause most of the other cases.
name: gas gangrene

description: A parasitic helminthiasis infectious disease that involves infection of the intestine, lungs, skin and central nervous system with nematode Strongyloides stercoralis.
name: strongyloidiasis

description: quantification of the amount of angiotensinogen in a sample
name: angiotensinogen measurement

description: Cerebral small vessel disease is the term currently used to pathological processes that affect the brain parenchymal circulation (arterioles, capillaries, and veins). It is a major contributor to stroke, and a leading cause of cognitive impairment and dementia.
name: cerebral small vessel disease

description: A condition or physical state produced by the ingestion, injection, inhalation of or exposure to a deleterious agent.
name: poisoning

description: Pulmonary veno-occlusive disease and/or pulmonary capillary hemangiomatosis (PVOD and/or PCH) constitutes a rare subgroup of pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH; see this term) characterized by obliterative fibrosis of the small pulmonary veins and venules and/or capillary infiltration of the pulmonary interstitium leading to increased pulmonary vascular resistance and right ventricular dysfunction.
name: Pulmonary veno-occlusive disease and/or pulmonary capillary haemangiomatosis

hasExactSynonym: pulmonary veno-occlusive disease and/or pulmonary capillary haemangiomatosis

description: Quantification of antibodies to the Epstein-Barr virus viral capsid antigen, typically in serum.
name: Epstein Barr viral capsid antigen IgG measurement

description: An injury to the skin and/or its underlying tissues that results from exposure of the affected area to extreme cold. [ NCI ]
name: frostbite

description: Measure of first-phase insulin response to glucose challenge.
name: Insulinogenic index measurement

description: A measure of the biomechanical properties of the cornea. Low corneal resistance factor may be indicative of keratoconus.
name: corneal resistance factor

description: Quantification of the presence or absence of a particular viral subtype in an individual.
name: viral subtype carrier status

description: A measurement of the genotype of a bacterial pathogen in an infected individual.
name: bacterial pathogen genotype measurement

description: The quantification of cholesteryl ester 22:6 levels in a sample.
name: cholesteryl ester 22:6 measurement

description: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of levodopa, a precurser of dopamine.
name: response to levodopa

description: The determination of the amount of galectin-8 in a sample
name: galectin-8 measurement

description: The determination of the amount of peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase F, mitochondrial in a sample
name: peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase F, mitochondrial measurement

description: The determination of the amount of protein kinase c alpha type in a sample
name: protein kinase c alpha type measurement

description: A small cell carcinoma arising from the cervix.
name: Cervical Small Cell Carcinoma

hasExactSynonym: small cell carcinoma of the cervix
small cell carcinoma of cervix uteri
small cell carcinoma of uterine cervix
small cell carcinoma of the cervix uteri
small cell carcinoma of the uterine cervix

description: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises centrally from the jaw. It derives from odontogenic epithelial remnants. It includes solid type squamous cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma that arises from an odontogenic cyst, and squamous cell carcinoma that derives from a keratocystic odontogenic tumor.
name: Primary Intraosseous Squamous Cell Carcinoma

description: A benign, intermediate, or malignant neoplasm that arises from the soft tissue. The most common types are lipomatous (fatty), vascular, smooth muscle, fibrous, and fibrohistiocytic neoplasms.
name: Soft Tissue Neoplasm

description: A neoplastic ductal proliferative lesion of the breast characterized by the formation of secondary lumens and prominent intraductal proliferation of a heterogeneous cellular population that may include epithelial cells, myoepithelial cells, or metaplastic apocrine cells.
name: Usual Ductal Breast Hyperplasia

hasExactSynonym: ductal breast hyperplasia of usual type

description: Infections with bacteria of the genus STREPTOCOCCUS.
name: streptococcal infection

description: Hidrotic ectodermal dysplasia, Halal type is a form of ectodermal dysplasia syndrome (see this term) characterized by trichodysplasia, with absent eyebrows and eyelashes, onychodysplasia, mild retrognathia, abnormal dermatoglyphics (excess of whorls on fingertips, radial loop on finger, hypothenar pattern), intellectual disability and normal teeth and sweating. Additional variable manifestations include high implanted or prominent ears, mild hearing loss, supernumerary nipple, café-au-lait spots, keratosis pilaris, and irregular menses. To date, four individuals from 2 generations of a consanguineous family of Portuguese descent have been described in the literature. Males and females were equally affected. Hidrotic ectodermal dysplasia, Halal type is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner.
name: Hidrotic ectodermal dysplasia, Halal type

hasExactSynonym: Ectodermal dysplasia with skin anomalies and intellectual disability

name: Pancreatic hypoplasia - diabetes - congenital heart disease
Partial deletion of the long arm of chromosome 11

hasExactSynonym: Partial monosomy of the long arm of chromosome 11

description: Peeling skin syndrome (PSS) type A is a non inflammatory form of generalized PSS (see this term), a type of ichthyosis (see this term), characterized by generalized white scaling and superficial painless peeling of the skin.
name: Peeling skin syndrome type A

hasExactSynonym: Non-inflammatory peeling skin syndrome type A
Generalized peeling skin syndrome type A
Non-inflammatory generalized peeling skin syndrome type A.

name: Partial monosomy of the short arm of chromosome X

hasExactSynonym: Partial duplication of the short arm of chromosome X

description: Disabling osteochondrodysplasia with osteosclerosis, cone-shaped metaphysis, and shortening of the diaphysis. It is endemic in parts of Siberia and northern China. Mineral deficiencies (e.g., selenium, iodine), fungal cereal contamination, and water contamination may be contributing factors in its etiology.
name: Kashin-Beck disease

description: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of  treatment with efavirenz, a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor used in treatment of HIV/AIDS.
name: response to efavirenz

description: A viral infectious disease that results_in infection in animals and humans, has_material_basis_in Enterovirus, which is transmitted_by direct contact with secretions from an infected person, transmitted_by fomites, transmitted_by droplet spread of oronasal secretions from an infected person, or transmitted_by ingestion of contaminated food.
name: Enterovirus infectious disease

description: An invasive adenocarcinoma characterized by cystic changes and the presence of malignant glandular cells which contain intracytoplasmic mucin. It may arise from the ovary, pancreas, appendix, and lung.
name: mucinous cystadenocarcinoma

description: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the retroperitoneum. The vast majority of cases are carcinomas, lymphomas, or sarcomas.
name: retroperitoneal cancer

hasExactSynonym: malignant neoplasm of retroperitoneum and peritoneum
malignant tumor of peritoneum and retroperitoneum

description: quantification of acute asthma exacerbations in an individual, generally defined by short courses of treatment with medication such as oral steroids.
name: asthma exacerbation measurement

description: Quantification of the external diameter of the carotid artery
name: carotid artery external diameter measurement

description: quantification of the amount of C-C motif chemokine 3-like 1 in a sample
name: C-C motif chemokine 3-like 1 measurement

description: quantification of the amount of OX-2 membrane glycoprotein in a sample
name: OX-2 membrane glycoprotein measurement

description: An immune response to foreign (donor) antigens due to fetomaternal hemorrhage (ie, transplacental passage of fetal erythrocytes) associated with delivery, trauma, spontaneous or induced abortion, ectopic pregnancy, or invasive obstetric procedures.
name: pregnancy induced alloimmunization

description: A carcinoma that arises from epithelial cells of the zone of skin
name: skin carcinoma

description: Quantification of an individual's appreciation of sucrose.
name: sucrose liking measurement

description: A quantification of ceramides.
name: ceramide measurement

description: Quantification of the volume of the fusiform gyrus.
name: fusiform gyrus volume measurement

name: fibroblast growth factor 6 measurement

description: The determination of the amount of serine protease HTRA2, mitochondrial in a sample
name: serine protease HTRA2, mitochondrial measurement

description: Quantification of the change in phenylalanine levels in an individual over time, e.g. over the course of several hours after a high-fat meal.
name: phenylalanine change measurement

description: A rare, extremely well differentiated cervical mucinous adenocarcinoma in which most of the neoplastic glands cannot be distinguished from the normal endocervical glands.
name: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Minimal Deviation Variant

hasExactSynonym: cervical mucinous adenocarcinoma, minimal deviation type
cervical mucinous adenocarcinoma, minimal deviation variant

description: A poorly circumscribed neoplasm arising from the soft tissues in infants. It is characterized by the presence of bland fibroblastic spindle cells, collagenous stroma formation, primitive mesenchymal round cells, and mature fat cells. These components combined form a distinct organoid pattern.
name: Fibrous Hamartoma of Infancy

description: Subependymoma is a rare and slow growing type of ependymoma, often presenting in middle-aged adults, found more commonly in men than in women, usually located in the fourth and lateral ventricles and manifesting with variable symptoms including headache, nausea, and loss of balance. In some cases it can be asymptomatic. It is usually associated with a better prognosis than other forms of ependymoma.
name: Subependymoma

description: Scimitar syndrome is characterized by a combination of cardiopulmonary anomalies including partial anomalous pulmonary venous return connection of the right lung to the inferior caval vein leading to the creation of a left-to-right shunt.
name: scimitar syndrome

description: A yellowish thickened lesion on the conjunctiva near the cornea representing a benign degenerative change in the conjunctiva caused by the leakage and deposition of certain blood proteins through the permeable capillaries near the limbus.
name: pinguecula

description: Caudal duplication (CD) is a rare developmental anomaly in which structures derived from the embryonic cloaca and notochord are duplicated to varying extents.
name: Caudal duplication

description: Adult-onset dystonia-parkinsonism is a rare neurodegenerative disease usually presenting before the age of 30 and which is characterized by dystonia, L-dopa-responsive parkinsonism, pyramidal signs and rapid cognitive decline.
name: Adult-onset dystonia-parkinsonism
Glaucoma - ectopia - microspherophakia - stiff joints - short stature

description: Congenital short bowel syndrome is a rare intestinal disorder of neonates of unknown etiology. Patients are born with a short small bowel (less than 75 cm in length) that compromises proper intestinal absorption and leads chronic diarrhea, vomiting and failure to thrive.
name: Congenital short bowel syndrome

description: 2000 IU/ml), recurring staphylococcal skin abscesses, and recurrent pneumonia with formation of pneumatoceles.
name: Autosomal dominant hyper-IgE syndrome

description: Microcephalic osteodysplastic primordial dwarfism type II (MOPDII) is a form of microcephalic primordial dwarfism (MPD; see this term) characterized by severe pre- and postnatal growth retardation, with marked microcephaly in proportion to body size, skeletal dysplasia, abnormal dentition, insulin resistance, and increased risk for cerebrovascular disease.
name: Microcephalic osteodysplastic primordial dwarfism type II

hasExactSynonym: Majewski osteodysplastic primordial dwarfism type II

description: measurement of the IgG antibody isotype produced by plasma cells in response to an Epstein Barr virus infection, specifically to the Epstein–Barr virus nuclear antigen 1
name: Epstein Barr virus nuclear antigen 1 IgG measurement

description: quantification of the amount of beta-Ala-His dipeptidase in a sample
name: beta-Ala-His dipeptidase measurement

description: quantification of the amount of C-C motif chemokine 21 in a sample
name: C-C motif chemokine 21 measurement

description: quantification of the amount of complement C1r subcomponent in a sample
name: complement C1r subcomponent measurement

description: Quantification of trimethyllysine (N6,N6,N6-trimethyl-L-lysine) in the blood.
name: trimethyllysine measurement

description: The determination of the ratio of carboxyhemoglobin compared to total hemoglobin present in a sample. The measurement may be expressed as a ratio or percentage. [ NCI ]
name: Carboxyhemoglobin to Total Hemoglobin Ratio Measurement

description: The determination of the number of neutrophilic metamyelocytes in a blood sample. [ NCI ]
name: Neutrophilic Metamyelocyte Count

description: A disorder characterized by neurodevelopmental abnormalities, including moderate to profound intellectual disability, with autistic features, seizures, severe impairments in speech, and gross motor delay.
name: neurodevelopmental disorder with absent language and variable seizures

description: The determination of the amount of insulin-degrading enzyme in a sample
name: insulin-degrading enzyme measurement

description: The determination of the amount of leucine-rich repeats and immunoglobulin-like domains protein 3 in a sample
name: leucine-rich repeats and immunoglobulin-like domains protein 3 measurement

name: probable g-protein coupled receptor 114 measurement

name: programmed cell death 1 ligand 1 measurement

name: tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 8 measurement

description: The quantification of S100 calcium-bnding protein B in a sample.
name: S100 calcium-binding protein B measurement

description: A usually aggressive high grade malignant bone-forming mesenchymal neoplasm arising from the surface of the bone.
name: High Grade Surface Osteosarcoma

description: A renal cell carcinoma characterized by morphologic features that do not fit easily into one of the other well-defined categories of renal cell carcinoma. Examples of such features include mixtures of morphologic patterns, mucin production, and sarcomatoid morphology.
name: Unclassified Renal Cell Carcinoma

description: a rare group of skin disorders characterized by tender, painful bumps below the surface of the skin (subcutaneous nodules) that usually lead to inflammation of the subcutaneous layer of fat (panniculitis). These nodules tend to be 1-2 centimeters in length and most often affect the legs and feet.
name: nodular nonsuppurative panniculitis

description: Twin twin transfusion syndrome (TTTS) is a rare condition seen in twin monochorionic pregnancies, typically developing during the 15-26 week gestation period and usually due to unbalanced intertwin placental anastomoses, where an unequal exchange of blood between twins causes oligohydramnios in one sac and polyhydramnios in the other which can lead to a high perinatal mortality rate and a high rate of disability in survivors if left untreated
name: twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome

hasExactSynonym: fetal blood loss from fetal hemorrhage into co-twin
Fetal blood loss from fetal hemorrhage into co-twin

description: A febrile disease caused by STREPTOCOCCUS PNEUMONIAE.
name: pneumococcal pneumonia

description: An overwhelming, irrational, and persistent fear of being diagnosed with cancer.
name: cancerophobia

description: A medullary thyroid gland carcinoma inherited through an autosomal dominant mode. It is associated with multiple endocrine neoplasia type II (2a) or III (2b).
name: hereditary thyroid gland medullary carcinoma

description: Tricho-retino-dento-digital syndrome is an autosomal dominant ectodermal dysplasia syndrome, characterized by uncombable hair syndrome (see this term), congenital hypotrichosis and dental abnormalities such as oligodontia (see this term) or hyperdontia, and associated with early-onset cataract, retinal pigmentary dystrophy, and brachydactyly with brachymetacarpia. Furthermore, hyperactivity and a mild intellectual deficit have been reported in affected patients.
name: Tricho-retino-dento-digital syndrome

hasExactSynonym: Uncombable hair - retinal pigmentary dystrophy - dental anomalies - brachydactyly

description: Cerebro-costo-mandibular syndrome (CCMS) is characterized at birth by posterior rib gaps and orofacial anomalies reminiscent of Pierre Robin syndrome (see this term) that include palatal defects (short hard palate, absent soft palate, absent uvula), micrognathia and glossoptosis.
name: Cerebro-costo-mandibular syndrome

description: The determination of the amount of oleic acid present in a sample.
name: oleic acid measurement

description: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a heparin stimulus.
name: response to heparin

description: quantification of the volume of the putamen, a round structure located at the base of the forebrain
name: putamen volume

description: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of treatment with the antineoplastic drug homoharringtonine, also known as omacetaxine mepesuccinate
name: response to homoharringtonine

description: A primary bacterial infectious disease that is caused by the bacteria of the genus Brucella, when humans come in contact with contaminated animals or animal products or ingestion of infected food products. The disease has_symptom fever, has_symptom sweat, has_symptom headache, has_symptom back pain, has_symptom physical weakness, has_symptom joint pain and has_symptom fatigue.
name: brucellosis

description: A mild, eruptive skin disease of milk cows caused by cowpox virus, with lesions occurring principally on the udder and teats. Human infection may occur while milking an infected animal.
name: cowpox

description: A primary bacterial infectious disease that is a sexually transmitted systemic disease, has_material_basis_in Treponema pallidum subsp pallidum, which is transmitted_by sexual contact, transmitted_by blood product transfusion, transmitted_by congenital method from mother to fetus or transmitted_by contact with infectious lesions. If left untreated, produces chancres, rashes, and systemic lesions in a clinical course with three stages continued over many years.
name: syphilis

hasExactSynonym: Treponema pallidum caused disease or disorder

description: quantification of  the absence of residual invasive disease in the breast and in the axillary lymph nodes at the completion of the neoadjuvant treatment
name: pathologic complete response measurement

description: Quantification of the susceptibility of developing multiple keratinocyte carcinomas (mKC), which is defined as the presence of more than one basal cell carcinoma (BCC) or squamous cell carcinoma (SCC).
name: multiple keratinocyte carcinoma susceptibility measurement

description: quantification of the amount of serine protease 27 in a sample
name: serine protease 27 measurement

description: quantification of P wave terminal force, the product of the duration and the amplitude of the terminal negative part of the P-wave
name: P wave terminal force measurement

description: quantification of some treatment outcome
name: treatment outcome measurement

description: Some quantification of the ability to inhibit maladaptive or inappropriate behavior.
name: behavioural inhibitory control measurement

description: The determination of the ratio of monocytoid cells compared to leukocytes present in a sample. The measurement may be expressed as a ratio or percentage. [ NCI ]
name: Monocytoid Cells to Leukocytes Ratio Measurement

description: The determination of the amount of rubricytes present in a sample. [ NCI ]
name: Rubricyte Count

description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.
name: edema

description: The phenotypic observation that death has occurred in groups of cells or in one or more tissues due to external factors, such as infection, toxins, mechanical trauma, loss of blood supply and other injuries (e.g. corrosion or burning). At the cellular level, morphological changes following necrosis include a translucent cytoplasm, swelling of organelles, modifications of the nucleus and increased cell volume (oncosis), culminating in the disruption of the plasma membrane and subsequent loss of intracellular contents. Necrotic cells do not fragment into discrete corpses as their apoptotic counterparts do. Moreover, their nuclei remain intact and can aggregate and accumulate in necrotic tissues.
name: necrosis

description: Inflammation of the eyelids near the eyelashes.
name: blepharitis

description: Treatment of disease through the use of drugs.
name: Pharmacotherapy

description: Quantification of the volume of the middle temporal gyrus.
name: middle temporal gyrus volume measurement

description: The quantification of triacylglycerol 52:6 levels in some body fluid, used as a biomarker for disease.
name: triacylglycerol 52:6 measurement

description: A quantification of the levels of 3-ureidopropionate in a sample.
name: 3-ureidopropionate measurement

description: Quantification of X-21444 levels in a sample.
name: X-21444 measurement

description: The determination of the amount of chloride intracellular channel protein 1 in a sample
name: chloride intracellular channel protein 1 measurement

description: The determination of the amount of hyaluronan and proteoglycan link protein 1 in a sample
name: hyaluronan and proteoglycan link protein 1 measurement

description: The determination of the amount of osteomodulin in a sample
name: osteomodulin measurement

description: A non-neoplastic hamartomatous polyp that arises from the colon and rectum. It is characterized by the presence of tortuous and cystically dilated glands, edematous changes, and inflammation.
name: Colorectal Juvenile Polyp

hasExactSynonym: juvenile polyp of the large bowel

description: A syndrome characterized by abnormal secretion of antidiuretic hormone in conjunction with neoplastic growth occurring anywhere in the body.
name: inappropriate ADH syndrome

hasExactSynonym: syndrome of inappropriate secretion of ADH
syndrome of Inappropriate Antidiuretic Hormone Secretion
syndrome of inappropriate secretion of antidiuretic hormone
syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion

description: Abdominal symptoms after removal of the gallbladder. The common postoperative symptoms are often the same as those present before the operation, such as colic, bloating, nausea, and vomiting. There is pain on palpation of the right upper quadrant and sometimes jaundice. The term is often used, inaccurately, to describe such postoperative symptoms not due to gallbladder removal.
name: postcholecystectomy syndrome

description: Conditions which feature clinical manifestations resembling primary Parkinson disease that are caused by a known or suspected condition. Examples include parkinsonism caused by vascular injury, drugs, trauma, toxin exposure, neoplasms, infections and degenerative or hereditary conditions. Clinical features may include bradykinesia, rigidity, parkinsonian gait, and masked facies. In general, tremor is less prominent in secondary parkinsonism than in the primary form. (From Joynt, Clinical Neurology, 1998, Ch38, pp39-42)
name: secondary Parkinson disease

description: A syndrome associated with damage to the spinal cord above the mid thoracic level (see SPINAL CORD INJURIES) characterized by a marked increase in the sympathetic response to minor stimuli such as bladder or rectal distention. Manifestations include HYPERTENSION; TACHYCARDIA (or reflex bradycardia); FEVER; FLUSHING; and HYPERHIDROSIS. Extreme hypertension may be associated with a STROKE. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, pp538 and 1232; J Spinal Cord Med 1997;20(3):355-60)
name: autonomic dysreflexia

description: A severe, rapidly fatal reaction occurring most commonly in children following an infectious illness. It is characterized by large, rapidly spreading skin hemorrhages, fever, or shock.
name: Purpura Fulminans

description: a noncardiogenic form of pulmonary edema that develops in unacclimatized healthy individuals at altitudes above 2500–3000 m
name: high altitude pulmonary edema

description: Epidermolysis bullosa simplex with pyloric atresia (EBS-PA) is a basal subtype of epidermolysis bullosa simplex (EBS, see this term) characterized by generalized severe blistering with widespread congenital absence of skin and pyloric atresia.
name: Epidermolysis bullosa simplex with pyloric atresia

description: Carnitine-acylcarnitine translocase (CACT) deficiency is a life-threatening, inherited disorder of fatty acid oxidation which usually presents in the neonatal period with severe hypoketotic hypoglycemia, hyperammonemia, cardiomyopathy and/or arrhythmia, hepatic dysfunction, skeletal muscle weakness, and encephalopathy.
name: Carnitine-acylcarnitine translocase deficiency

description: Spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia, Cantu type is an extremely rare type of spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia (see this term) described in about 5 patients to date and characterized by clinical signs including short stature, peculiar facies with blepharophimosis, upward slanted eyes, abundant eyebrows and eyelashes, coarse voice, and short hands and feet (brachymetacarpalia, brachymetatarsalia and brachyphalangia).
name: Spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia, Cantu type

description: Neutrophil immunodeficiency syndrome is a primary immunodeficiency characterized by neutrophilia with severe neutrophil dysfunction, leukocytosis, a predisposition to bacterial infections and poor wound healing, including an absence of pus in infected areas.
name: Neutrophil immunodeficiency syndrome

description: Hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HPRT) deficiency is a hereditary disorder of purine metabolism associated with uric acid overproduction and a continuum spectrum of neurological manifestations depending on the degree of the enzyme deficiency.
name: Hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase deficiency

description: Generalized dominant dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa (DDEB-gen) is a subtype of dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa (DEB, see this term), formerly known as DDEB, Pasini and Cockayne-Touraine types, characterized by generalized blistering, milia formation, atrophic scarring, and dystrophic nails.
name: Generalized dominant dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa

hasExactSynonym: Autosomal dominant dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa, Pasini and Cockayne-Touraine types

description: Autosomal recessive primary microcephaly (MCPH) is a rare genetically heterogeneous disorder of neurogenic brain development characterized by reduced head circumference at birth with no gross anomalies of brain architecture and variable degrees of intellectual impairment.
name: Autosomal recessive primary microcephaly

description: Mitochondrial myopathy-lactic acidosis-deafness is a type of metabolic myopathy described only in two sisters to date, presenting during childhood, and characterized clinically by growth failure, severe muscle weakness, and moderate neural deafness and biochemically by metabolic acidosis, elevated serum pyruvate concentration, hyperalaninemia and hyperalaninuria. There have been no further descriptions in the literature since 1973.
name: Mitochondrial myopathy - lactic acidosis - deafness

hasExactSynonym: Mitochondrial myopathy - lactic acidosis - hearing loss

description: An encephalomyelitis of horses, sheep and cattle caused by borna disease virus.
name: borna disease

description: A spectrum of rare post-infectious neuropathies that usually occur in otherwise healthy patients. GBS is clinically heterogeneous and encompasses acute inflammatory demyelinating polyradiculoneuropathy (AIDP), acute motor axonal neuropathy (AMAN) and acute motor-sensory axonal neuropathy (AMSAN), Miller-Fisher syndrome (MFS) and some other regional variants.
name: Guillain-Barre syndrome

description: Quantification of some aspect of the carotid artery, eg its size, diameter or stiffness
name: carotid artery measurement

description: quantification of some aspect of nose morphology such as nose wing breadth, nose tip shape or nose profile
name: nose morphology measurement

description: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a escitalopram stimulus. Escitalopram is the (S)-stereoisomer (Left-enantiomer) of the earlier Lundbeck drug citalopram, hence the name escitalopram. Whether escitalopram exhibits superior therapeutic properties to citalopram or merely represents an example of "evergreening" is controversial.
name: response to escitalopram

description: quantification in a sample of the organochlorine pesticide dichlorodiphenyltrichloroethane (DDT) or any metabolite derived from DDT, eg 2, 2-bis (4-chlorophenyl)-1, 1-dichloroethene (p,p′-DDE)
name: DDT metabolite measurement

description: quantification in a sample of alpha-tocopherol, a form of vitamin E that is preferentially absorbed and accumulated in humans
name: alpha-tocopherol measurement

description: quantification of some aspect of fear of pain, generallly through the use of a structured questionnaire
name: fear of pain measurement

description: A soft and painless polypoid mass that arises from the female genital tract.
name: female genital tract polyp

hasExactSynonym: polyp in the female reproductive tract

description: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 2T (CMT2T) is a slowly progressive autosomal recessive sensorimotor peripheral neuropathy with onset in middle age (Higuchi et al., 2016).
name: charcot-marie-tooth disease, axonal, type 2t

description: Is a quantification of thyroxine-binding globulin. Inherited abnormalities in the level of serum TBG have been classified as complete deficiency (TBG-CD), partial deficiency (TBG-PD), and excess (TBG-E). Patients are euthyroid (summary by Mori et al., 1995).
name: thyroxine-binding globulin measurement

description: Any skin carcinoma that is not melanoma, with the most common types being basal cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma
name: non-melanoma skin carcinoma

description: Quantification of symptom associated with nicotine dependence.
name: nicotine dependence symptom count

description: Quantification of the amount of factor VII activating protease in a blood sample
name: factor VII activating protease measurement

hasExactSynonym: Hepatocyte growth factor activator-like protein measurement

description: The prevention of conception or impregnation by the use of devices or drugs or surgery. [ NCI ]
name: contraception

description: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the inner ear. Causes are inner ear infections, head injuries, and neoplasms (e.g., acoustic schwannoma). Symptoms include dizziness, imbalance, nausea, and vision problems.
name: inner ear disease

hasExactSynonym: disease or disorder of internal ear

description: Bronchodilation involves widening of air passage lumina, typically due to bronchial smooth muscle relaxation, and leads to increased air flow.
name: bronchodilation

description: Quantification of the volume of the temporal lobe of the brain.
name: temporal lobe volume measurement

description: The quantification of cholesteryl ester 18:1 levels in a sample.
name: cholesteryl ester 18:1 measurement

description: The quantification of lysophosphatidylethanolamine 18:0 levels in a sample.
name: lysophosphatidylethanolamine 18:0 measurement

description: Developmental and epileptic encephalopathy-94 (DEE94) is a severe form of epilepsy characterized by onset of multiple seizure types in the first few years of life and associated with poor prognosis. Affected individuals have cognitive regression and impaired intellectual development (summary by Carvill et al., 2013).
name: developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 94

description: The determination of the amount of bone morphogenetic protein 10 in a sample
name: bone morphogenetic protein 10 measurement

description: The determination of the amount of bone sialoprotein 2 in a sample
name: bone sialoprotein 2 measurement

description: The determination of the amount of complement C3D fragment in a sample
name: complement C3D fragment measurement

description: The determination of the amount of ectonucleotide pyrophosphatase/phosphodiesterase family member 7 in a sample
name: ectonucleotide pyrophosphatase/phosphodiesterase family member 7 measurement

description: The determination of the amount of SLAM family member 5 in a sample
name: SLAM family member 5 measurement

description: Quantification of the volume of the spleen.
name: spleen volume

description: Metabolic acidosis characterized by the accumulation of lactate in the body. It is caused by tissue hypoxia.
name: lactic acidosis

description: A neuroglial tumor that arises from the brain stem.
name: Brain Stem Glioma

description: A diffuse large B-cell lymphoma that arises from the colon or rectum.
name: Colorectal Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma

hasExactSynonym: diffuse large B-cell lymphoma of colorectum

description: A carcinoma that arises from the digestive system and is characterized by the presence of a malignant glandular epithelial component and a malignant neuroendocrine component. At least 30% of either component should be present for the diagnosis to be made.
name: Digestive System Mixed Adenoneuroendocrine Carcinoma

description: A carcinoma that arises from the gallbladder. It is characterized by the presence of glandular and squamous malignant epithelial components.
name: Gallbladder Adenosquamous Carcinoma

description: A WHO grade I meningioma characterized by the presence of prominent chronic inflammatory infiltrates that predominate over the meningioma cells.
name: Lymphoplasmacyte-Rich Meningioma

description: A rare soft tissue tumor of uncertain lineage characterized by the presence of neoplastic spindle to round cells forming cords in a fibromyxoid stroma. The lesions are associated with the formation of metaplastic bone. Most patients present with painless subcutaneous masses. Recurrences have been reported in a minority of patients.
name: Ossifying Fibromyxoid Tumor

description: A neuroendocrine tumor arising from the pancreas. It is characterized by inappropriate secretion of gastrin and associated with Zollinger Ellison syndrome. The latter is characterized by the presence of peptic ulcer, gastroesophageal reflux disease, abdominal pain, diarrhea, and malabsorption.
name: Pancreatic Gastrinoma

description: Prolactinoma is a usually benign neoplasm of the pituitary gland that results in hyperprolactinemia. The most common clinical manifestations are amenorrhea and infertility in women; and impotence, decreased libido and infertility in men.
name: Prolactin-Producing Pituitary Gland Adenoma

hasExactSynonym: prolactin secreting adenoma of pituitary gland
prolactin producing adenoma of pituitary gland
prolactin secreting adenoma of the pituitary gland
prolactin producing adenoma of the pituitary
prolactin secreting adenoma of the pituitary
prolactin producing adenoma of the pituitary gland

description: a skin disease marked by small and itchy rashes. Miliariais a common ailment in hot and humid conditions, such as in the tropics and during the summer season.
name: miliaria

description: Desmoplastic small round cell tumor (DSRCT) is an aggressive soft tissue cancer that typically arises in serous lined surfaces of the abdominal or pelvic peritoneum, and spreads to the omentum, lymph nodes and hematogenously disseminates especially to the liver. Extraserous primary location has been reported in exceptional cases.
name: desmoplastic small round cell tumor

description: Liver disease lasting six months or more, caused by an adverse drug effect. The adverse effect may result from a direct toxic effect of a drug or metabolite, or an idiosyncratic response to a drug or metabolite.
name: drug-induced hepatitis

description: Hearing loss due to disease of the AUDITORY PATHWAYS (in the CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM) which originate in the COCHLEAR NUCLEI of the PONS and then ascend bilaterally to the MIDBRAIN, the THALAMUS, and then the AUDITORY CORTEX in the TEMPORAL LOBE. Bilateral lesions of the auditory pathways are usually required to cause central hearing loss. Cortical deafness refers to loss of hearing due to bilateral auditory cortex lesions. Unilateral BRAIN STEM lesions involving the cochlear nuclei may result in unilateral hearing loss.
name: sensorineural hearing loss

description: A systemic autoimmune disorder that typically affects medium and large ARTERIES, usually leading to occlusive granulomatous vasculitis with transmural infiltrate containing multinucleated GIANT CELLS. The TEMPORAL ARTERY is commonly involved. This disorder appears primarily in people over the age of 50. Symptoms include FEVER; FATIGUE; HEADACHE; visual impairment; pain in the jaw and tongue; and aggravation of pain by cold temperatures. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed)
name: temporal arteritis

description: A variety of TUBERCULOSIS affecting various birds, including chickens and ducks. It is caused by MYCOBACTERIUM AVIUM and characterized by tubercles consisting principally of epithelioid cells.
name: Tuberculosis, Avian

description: Oral submucous fibrosis (OSMF) is a chronic, progressive disease that alters the fibroelasticity of the oral submucosa, prevalent in India and Southeast Asia but rare elsewhere, and characterized by burning and pain in the oral cavity, loss of gustatory sensation, the presence of blanched fibrous bands and stiffening of the oral mucosa and oro-pharynx (leading to trismus and a progressive reduction in mouth opening) and an increased risk of developing oral squamous cell cancer (3-19%). It is usually associated with the chewing of the areca nut (an ingredient in betel quid) but the exact etiology is unknown and there is currently no effective treatment.
name: oral submucous fibrosis

hasExactSynonym: oral submucosal fibrosis, including of tongue

description: An acute B-lymphoblastic leukemia occurring in children.
name: childhood B acute lymphoblastic leukemia

hasExactSynonym: B cell childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia
B cell pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia
B cell pediatric acute lymphocytic leukemia
B cell childhood acute lymphocytic leukemia

description: A group of acute infections caused by herpes simplex virus type 1 or type 2 that is characterized by the development of one or more small fluid-filled vesicles with a raised erythematous base on the skin or mucous membrane. It occurs as a primary infection or recurs due to a reactivation of a latent infection. (Dorland, 27th ed.)
name: Herpes simplex infection

description: Cleidorhizomelic syndrome is a rhizo-mesomelic dysplasia characterized by rhizomelic short stature/dwarfism in combination with lateral clavicular defects. Additional manifestations include brachydactyly with bilateral clinodactyly and hypoplastic middle phalanx of the fifth digit. X-ray demonstrated an apparent Y-shaped or bifid distal clavicle. Cleidorhizomelic syndrome has been reported in one family (mother and son) and is suspected to be transmitted in an autosomal dominant manner. There have been no further descriptions in the literature since 1988.
name: Cleidorhizomelic syndrome

description: 1p36 deletion syndrome is a chromosomal anomaly characterized by distinctive facial dysmorphic features, hypotonia, developmental delay, intellectual disability, seizures, heart defects, hearing impairment and prenatal onset growth deficiency.
name: 1p36 deletion syndrome

description: gene (Xq28), encoding coagulation factor IX.
name: Symptomatic form of hemophilia B in female carriers

description: Progressive non-infectious anterior vertebral fusion (PAVF) is an early childhood spinal disorder characterized by the gradual onset of thoracic and/or lumbar spine ankylosis often in conjunction with kyphosis with distinctive radiological features.
name: Progressive non-infectious anterior vertebral fusion

description: Adult-onset citrullinemia type 1 is a form of citrullinemia type 1 (see this term) characterized clinically by adult onset of symptoms including variable hyperammonemia and less striking neurological findings which may include intense headache, scotomas, migraine-like episodes, ataxia, slurred speech, lethargy, and drowsiness. Serious increased intracranial pressure may occur.
name: Adult-onset citrullinemia type I

description: Quantification of the amount of ticagrelor in a sample. Ticagrelor is a platelet aggregation inhibitor used for the prevention of thrombotic events in people with acute coronary syndrome or myocardial infarction with ST elevation.
name: ticagrelor measurement

description: A rubella that results_in infection has_material_basis_in Rubella virus, which is transmitted_by congenital method to the developing fetus of a pregnant woman who has contracted rubella during her first trimester.
name: congenital rubella

description: A viral infectious disease that results_in infection located_in skin, has_material_basis_in Orf virus, which is transmitted_by contact with infected or recently vaccinated animals, or transmitted_by fomites carrying the virus. The infection has_symptom lesions on the finger, hand, arm, face, and penis.
name: contagious pustular dermatitis

description: A primary systemic mycosis that results_in systemic fungal infection, has_material_basis_in Histoplasma capsulatum var capsulatum or has_material_basis_in Histoplasma capsulatum var duboisii, transmitted_by airborne spores and has_symptom nonproductive cough, has_symptom headache, has_symptom loss of appetite and has_symptom muscle pains.
name: histoplasmosis

description: Allergic reaction to peanuts that is triggered by the immune system.
name: peanut allergic reaction

hasExactSynonym: nut allergic reaction of pigmented ciliary epithelial cell
pigmented ciliary epithelial cell nut allergic reaction

description: quantification of some zinc in a blood sample
name: blood zinc measurement

description: period of manic or hypomanic symptoms that occurs as part of a wider mental or psychiatric disorder such as bipolar disorder
name: manic or hypomanic episode

description: quantification of some aspect of particulate matter air pollution, such as daily levels of exposure
name: particulate matter air pollution measurement

description: A viral infectious disease that results in inflammation of the brain caused by Chikungunya virus. The disease is usually manifested as fever, arthralgia and rash.
name: Chikungunya encephalitis

description: A neoplasm of immature malignant lymphocytes (lymphoblasts) committed to the B-cell or T-cell lineage. Neoplasms involving the bone marrow and the peripheral blood are called precursor lymphoblastic leukemias or acute lymphoblastic leukemias. Neoplasms involving primarily lymph nodes or extranodal sites are called lymphoblastic lymphomas. -- 2003
name: precursor lymphoblastic lymphoma/leukemia

description: quantification of a reduction in glucose metabolism.
name: glucose metabolism decline measurement

description: Volume of hippocampal tail.
name: hippocampal tail volume

description: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the anal canal or anal margin. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include hemorrhoids and anal ulcer. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include carcinoma, lymphoma, and melanoma.
name: anus disease

description: Quantification of some aspect of the use of glucocorticoids.
name: Glucocorticoid use measurement

description: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a calcineurin inhibitor stimulus.
name: response to calcineurin inhibitor

description: Quantification of the rate of change in respiratory symptoms of an individual over the course of time (either through clinical examination or through a standardised questionnaire), used as an indicator of improvement or decay of respiratory function.
name: respiratory symptom change measurement

description: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation of one of the anatomic dilations of the ascending aorta, which occurs just above the aortic valve.
name: dilatation of the sinus of Valsalva

description: Quantification of aspartate levels in a sample.
name: aspartate measurement

description: A malunion fracture is a fracture which has healed in such a position that it can cause malalignment or deformity.
name: malunion fracture

description: The determination of the amount of 72 kda type IV collagenase in a sample
name: 72 kda type IV collagenase measurement

description: The determination of the amount of artemin in a sample
name: artemin measurement

description: The determination of the amount of carbonic anhydrase 1 in a sample
name: carbonic anhydrase 1 measurement

description: The determination of the amount of heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein a/b in a sample
name: heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein a/b measurement

description: Quantification of the circulating pattern recognition receptor CD14 in a sample such as blood plasma.
name: soluble CD14 measurement

description: Quantification of the levels of N-desmethylclozapine, also known as norclozapine, in blood plasma. N-desmethylclozapine is a major active metabolite of clozapine, an antipsychotic drug used to treat schizophrenia.
name: plasma N-desmethylclozapine measurement

description: A non-metastasizing neoplasm that arises from the ovary. Representative examples include serous cystadenoma, mucinous cystadenoma, clear cell adenofibroma, benign Brenner tumor, thecoma, and fibroma.
name: Benign Ovarian Neoplasm

description: A benign or malignant extra-adrenal paraganglioma arising from paraganglia in the head and neck. Representative examples include the carotid body and jugulotympanic paragangliomas.
name: Head and Neck Paraganglioma

hasExactSynonym: paraganglioma of the head and neck

description: A granuloma located in the liver.
name: Hepatic Granuloma

description: A non-neoplastic polyp that arises from the stomach and is characterized by the presence of smooth muscle branching bands, and hyperplasia with cystic dilatation of the foveolar epithelium.
name: Peutz-Jeghers Polyp of the Stomach

description: Increased intracellular or extracellular fluid in brain tissue. Cytotoxic brain edema (swelling due to increased intracellular fluid) is indicative of a disturbance in cell metabolism, and is commonly associated with hypoxic or ischemic injuries (see hypoxia, brain). An increase in extracellular fluid may be caused by increased brain capillary permeability (vasogenic edema), an osmotic gradient, local blockages in interstitial fluid pathways, or by obstruction of csf flow (e.g., obstructive hydrocephalus). (From Childs Nerv Syst 1992 Sep; 8(6):301-6)
name: brain edema

description: Overactive functioning of the spleen, resulting in excessive destruction of blood cells.
name: hypersplenism

description: A neoplasm with perivascular epithelioid cell differentiation, often associated with tuberous sclerosis. It is characterized by the presence of smooth muscle and epithelioid cells and by the proliferation of lymphatic vessels. Sites of involvement include the lymph nodes, lung, mediastinum, and retroperitoneum.
name: lymphangiomyoma

description: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the maxillary sinus. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include Schneiderian papilloma and salivary gland-type adenoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma and lymphoma.
name: maxillary sinus neoplasm

description: Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) is an acute or chronic inflammation in the pelvic cavity. It is most commonly caused by sexually transmitted diseases, including chlamydia and gonorrhea that have ascended into the uterus, fallopian tubes, or ovaries as a result of intercourse or childbirth, or of surgical procedures, including insertion of IUDs or abortion. PID may be either symptomatic or asymptomatic. It may cause infertility and it may raise the risk of ectopic pregnancy. PID is a disease associated with HIV infection.
name: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease

description: A T lymphoblastic lymphoma that occurs during childhood.
name: childhood T lymphoblastic lymphoma

description: Lymphedema cholestasis syndrome (LCS) is a rare genetic disorder characterized by neonatal intrahepatic cholestasis, often lessening and becoming intermittent with age, and severe chronic lymphedema which mainly affects the lower limbs. Patients often present fat malabsorption leading to failure to thrive, fat soluble vitamin deficiency with bleeding, rickets, neuropathy. In 25% of cases, cirrhosis occurs, during childhood or later in life.
name: Cholestasis-lymphedema syndrome
Sterile multifocal osteomyelitis with periostitis and pustulosis

hasExactSynonym: Autoinflammatory disease due to interleukin-1 receptor antagonist deficiency

name: Congenital primary megaureter, nonrefluxing and unobstructed form

description: Microcephaly - albinism - digital anomalies syndrome is a very rare syndrome associating microcephaly, micrognathia, oculocutaneous albinism, hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of fingers and agenesia of the distal end of the right big toe.
name: Microcephaly - albinism - digital anomalies

description: An instance of mesenchymal cell neoplasm that is caused by an inherited modification of the individual's genome.
name: Genetic soft tissue tumor

description: quantification of the cytoarchitecture, ie the cellular composition, of the prefrontal cortex of the brain
name: prefrontal cortex cytoarchtiectural measurement

description: ratio of sitting height to total body height
name: sitting height ratio

description: Dysfunction of the aortic valve characterized by incomplete valve closure.
name: aortic valve insufficiency

description: A parasitic stramenopiles infectious disease that involves infection of the intestine with a pathogenic heterokont Blastocystis hominis. The symptoms include watery diarrhea, abdominal pain, perianal pruritus, and excessive flatulence.
name: Blastocystis hominis infectious disease

description: A kidney cancer that is found in the kidney and is usually found before birth by ultrasound or within the first 3 months of life.
name: mesoblastic nephroma

description: A movement disease that is of unknown etiology characterized by progressive rigidity.
name: Stiff-Person syndrome

hasRelatedSynonym: Stiff person syndrome and related disorders

description: quantification of accumulation of amyloid plaques in the brain over a long period of time (typically several years), measured by using PET scan imaging technology. The accumulation of amyloid plaques can be a biomarker for Alzheimer's disease
name: amyloid plaque accumulation rate

description: Any measurable or observable characteristic related to the shape, structure, color, or pattern of the fine, keratinized filamentous growths arising from the epidermis of mammals.
name: outer ear morphology trait

description: quantification of the amount of cystatin-SN in a sample
name: cystatin-SN measurement

description: Non-cardia gastric carcinoma is a gastric carcinoma arising from distal regions of the stomach.
name: gastric non-cardia carcinoma

description: Neuralgic syndromes which feature chronic or recurrent facial pain as the primary manifestation of disease. Disorders of the trigeminal and facial nerves are frequently associated with these conditions.
name: facial neuralgia

description: A disease involving the central nervous system.
name: central nervous system disease

hasExactSynonym: central nervous system disease or disorder
disease or disorder of central nervous system
disease of the central nervous system

description: A measurement indicating ability of an individual to hear what was said with hearing aids.
name: able to hear with hearing aids

description: An increase in respiratory secretions.
name: increased respiratory secretion

description: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a oxcarbazepine stimulus, an anti-epileptic drug.
name: response to oxcarbazepine

description: Quantification of some sweet beverage consumption or sweet beverage consumption-related behaviour, usually self-reported via a questionnaire.
name: sweet beverage consumption measurement

description: Quantification of the volume of the Lateral orbital frontal cortex.
name: lateral orbital frontal cortex volume measurement

description: Quantification of galactose levels in a sample.
name: galactose measurement

description: Quantification of 3-hydroxybutyrate in a sample.
name: 3-hydroxybutyrate measurement

description: Quantification of the change in glycoprotein levels in an individual over time, e.g. over the course of several hours after a high-fat meal.
name: glycoprotein change measurement

description: Quantification of some aspect of the use of insulin.
name: insulin use measurement

description: A non-neoplastic, hamartomatous polyp that arises from the colon and rectum. This group includes the juvenile polyp, Peutz-Jeghers polyp, and Cowden-associated polyp.
name: Colorectal Hamartoma

description: A carcinoma that arises from epithelial cells of the fallopian tube.
name: Fallopian Tube Carcinoma

description: A benign, intermediate, or malignant mesenchymal neoplasm composed of fibrohistiocytic cells, spindle fibroblastic cells, and histiocytes, in a storiform pattern.
name: cutaneous fibrous histiocytoma

hasExactSynonym: benign fibrous histiocytoma of the skin

description: Three or more consecutive spontaneous abortions.
name: habitual abortion

description: A condition in which blood glucose levels are high, but not high enough to be classified as type 2 diabetes.
name: prediabetes syndrome

description: The mother develops antibodies against red blood cell Rhesus antigens. This may lead to potential fetal adverse outcomes such as anemia.
name: Rh isoimmunization

hasExactSynonym: Rh incompatibility affecting management of mother

description: Compression of the heart by accumulated fluid (PERICARDIAL EFFUSION) or blood (HEMOPERICARDIUM) in the PERICARDIUM surrounding the heart. The affected cardiac functions and CARDIAC OUTPUT can range from minimal to total hemodynamic collapse.
name: Cardiac Tamponade

description: Conditions which produce injury or dysfunction of the second cranial or optic nerve, which is generally considered a component of the central nervous system. Damage to optic nerve fibers may occur at or near their origin in the retina, at the optic disk, or in the nerve, optic chiasm, optic tract, or lateral geniculate nuclei. Clinical manifestations may include decreased visual acuity and contrast sensitivity, impaired color vision, and an afferent pupillary defect.
name: Foster-Kennedy syndrome

description: A disorder characterized by proliferation of arborizing small vessels, prominent immunoblastic proliferations and amorphous acidophilic interstitial material. Clinical manifestations include fever, sweats, weight loss, generalized lymphadenopathy and frequently hepatosplenomegaly.
name: Immunoblastic Lymphadenopathy

description: Forms of combined immunodeficiency caused by mutations in the gene for INTERLEUKIN RECEPTOR COMMON GAMMA SUBUNIT. Both severe and non-severe subtypes of the disease have been identified.
name: X-Linked Combined Immunodeficiency Diseases

hasExactSynonym: combined immunodeficiency, X-linked, moderate, X-linked recessive

description: A type of 3MC syndrome which is that has material basis in homozygous mutation in the MASP1 gene on chromosome 3q27.
name: 3MC syndrome 1

hasExactSynonym: 3MC syndrome caused by mutation in MASP1

name: Lethal ataxia with deafness and optic atrophy

description: The severe infantile form of carnitine palmitoyltransferase II (CPT II) deficiency (see this term), an inherited disorder that affects mitochondrial oxidation of long chain fatty acids (LCFA), is the early-onset form of the disease.
name: Carnitine palmitoyl transferase II deficiency, severe infantile form

hasExactSynonym: Carnitine palmitoyl transferase II deficiency, hepatocardiomuscular form
Carnitine palmitoyl transferase deficiency type 2, hepatocardiomuscular form
Carnitine palmitoyl transferase deficiency type 2, severe infantile form

description: Facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy (FSHD) is characterized by progressive muscle weakness with focal involvement of the facial, shoulder and limb muscles.
name: Facioscapulohumeral dystrophy

description: Autoimmune lymphoproliferative syndrome (ALPS) with recurrent viral infections is a rare genetic disorder characterized by lymphadenopathy and/or splenomegaly and recurrent infections due to herpes viruses.
name: Autoimmune lymphoproliferative syndrome with recurrent viral infections

description: A malignant neoplasm arising from mesothelial cells in the pleura. It is characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells with an epithelioid appearance. In the majority of cases, the neoplastic epithelioid cells lack significant cytologic atypia; mitotic figures are infrequently seen. In a minority of cases, the neoplastic cells are poorly differentiated and there is evidence of nuclear atypia and increased mitotic activity.
name: malignant epithelioid mesothelioma

description: quantification of glucose effectiveness, the capacity of glucose to enhance its own cellular uptake and to suppress endogenous glucose production
name: glucose effectiveness measurement

description: A trichostrongyloidiasis that involves parasitic infection of the ruminant abomasum by nematodes of the genus Haemonchus resulting in anemia, dehydration, diarrhea and accumulation of fluid in the abdomen, gut wall, thoracic cavity and submandibular tissue.
name: haemonchiasis

description: A legionellosis that is characterized by severe form of infection producing pneumonia. Symptoms include fever, chills, and cough.
name: Legionnaires' disease

description: Schistosomiasis of the brain, spinal cord, or meninges caused by infections with trematodes of the genus schistosoma (primarily schistosoma japonicum; schistosoma mansoni; and schistosoma haematobium in humans). S. japonicum infections of the nervous system may cause an acute meningoencephalitis or a chronic encephalopathy. S. mansoni and S. haematobium nervous system infections are associated with acute transverse myelitis involving the lower portions of the spinal cord. (From Joynt, Clinical Neurology, 1998, Ch27, pp61-2)
name: neuroschistosomiasis

description: Dermatological pruritic lesion in the feet, caused by Trichophyton rubrum, T. mentagrophytes, or Epidermophyton floccosum.
name: tinea pedis

description: quantification of the change in triglyceride levels in an individual over time, eg over the course of several hours after a high-fat meal
name: triglyceride change measurement

description: The magnitude of the R wave, which is the initial upward deflection of the QRS complex following the Q wave representing early depolarization of the ventricles as illustrated by an electrocardiograph.
name: R wave amplitude

description: quantification of the amount of C-C motif chemokine 14 in a sample
name: C-C motif chemokine 14 measurement

description: quantification of the amount cellular adhesion molecule in a sample
name: cellular adhesion molecule measurement

description: Quantification of an individual's susceptibility to shingles
name: susceptibility to rubella infection measurement

description: A pause in breathing or shallow breaths during REM sleep.
name: sleep apnea measurement during REM sleep

description: The determination of the amount of matrix metalloproteinase 8 present in a sample
name: matrix metalloproteinase 8 measurement

description: Quantification of the size of VLDL particles, typically their diameter.
name: very low density lipoprotein particle size measurement

description: A measurement of some aspect of cognitive systems e.g. those responsible for various cognitive processes.  Based on the NIH NIMH's research domain criteria (RDoC).  https://www.nimh.nih.gov/research-priorities/rdoc/definitions-of-the-rdoc-domains-and-constructs.shtml
name: cognitive domain measurement

description: The E/A ratio is a marker of the function of the left ventricle of the heart. It represents the ratio of peak velocity blood flow from gravity in early diastole (the E wave) to peak velocity flow in late diastole caused by atrial contraction (the A wave).
name: E/A ratio

description: A finding indicating decreased oxygen levels in the blood. [ NCI ]
name: hypoxemia

description: A nervous system disorder characterized by diminished responsiveness and consciousness, and rigidity of the body.
name: catalepsy

description: A quantification of some aspect of cocaine use
name: cocaine use measurement

description: quantification of the amount of mucin 16 in a sample
name: stromelysin‐1 measurement

description: Cellular proliferation of hematopoietic cells where a substantial proportion of the cells is derived from a single hematopoietic stem cell lineage.
name: clonal hematopoiesis

description: Quantification of 3-aminoisobutyrate in a sample.
name: 3-aminoisobutyrate measurement

description: The determination of the amount of heat shock protein hsp 90-alpha/beta in a sample
name: heat shock protein hsp 90-alpha/beta measurement

description: A sporadic or less frequently familial neoplasm, arising from the glandular epithelium of the stomach, small intestine, biliary tract, colon, and rectum. It is a polypoid or flat circumscribed lesion. Morphologically, it is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic glandular cells and it is associated with dysplasia. According to the growth pattern, it may be classified as tubular, villous, or tubulovillous. The dysplasia is classified as mild, moderate, or severe. The frequency of malignant transformation depends on the size of the lesion and the degree of dysplasia. Larger adenomas with severe dysplastic changes (sometimes called carcinoma in situ) carry a higher risk of progressing to invasive adenocarcinoma. Gastrointestinal adenomas may present as solitary or multifocal lesions. Familial adenomas tend to be multifocal and carry a higher risk of malignant transformation.
name: Digestive System Adenoma

description: A rare entity characterized by localized but destructive growth of a tumor consisting of highly atypical, immature mast cells.(WHO, 2001)
name: Mast Cell Sarcoma

description: An adenoid cystic carcinoma that arises from the pharynx.
name: Pharyngeal Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma

hasExactSynonym: adenoid cystic carcinoma of the pharynx

description: A rare, highly aggressive carcinoma that arises from the salivary gland, predominantly the parotid gland. It is characterized by the presence of large pleomorphic malignant cells with abundant cytoplasm. Patients usually present with a rapidly growing mass.
name: Salivary Gland Large Cell Carcinoma

hasExactSynonym: large cell undifferentiated salivary gland carcinoma

description: A malignant germ cell neoplasm arising from the testis. It is composed of primitive epithelial cells arranged in solid, papillary, and glandular configurations. Most patients present with a testicular mass, which may be associated with pain. More than half of the patients have metastatic disease at diagnosis. The form of treatment following radical orchiectomy is stage dependent.
name: Testicular Embryonal Carcinoma

description: Impairment of the bile flow caused by an obstruction in the portion of the bile duct system located outside of the liver.
name: extrahepatic cholestasis

description: Disease involving the femoral nerve. The femoral nerve may be injured by ISCHEMIA (e.g., in association with DIABETIC NEUROPATHIES), nerve compression, trauma, COLLAGEN DISEASES, and other disease processes. Clinical features include MUSCLE WEAKNESS or PARALYSIS of hip flexion and knee extension, ATROPHY of the QUADRICEPS MUSCLE, reduced or absent patellar reflex, and impaired sensation over the anterior and medial thigh.
name: femoral neuropathy

hasExactSynonym: peripheral nerve lesion of femoral nerve

description: Encephalopathy resulting from hypertension.
name: hypertensive encephalopathy

description: Disorder characterized by a wide range of structural changes in PERITONEUM, resulting from fibrogenic or inflammatory processes. Peritoneal fibrosis is a common complication in patients receiving PERITONEAL DIALYSIS and contributes to its gradual decrease in efficiency.
name: Peritoneal Fibrosis

description: Presence of air or gas within the intracranial cavity (e.g., epidural space, subdural space, intracerebral, etc.) which may result from traumatic injuries, fistulous tract formation, erosions of the skull from NEOPLASMS or infection, NEUROSURGICAL PROCEDURES, and other conditions.
name: Pneumocephalus

description:
Dysentery is a type of gastroenteritis that results in diarrhea with blood. Other symptoms may include fever, abdominal pain,[3] and a feeling of incomplete defecation.

It is caused by a number of types of infection such as bacteria, viruses, parasitic worms, or protozoa. The mechanism is an inflammatory disorder of the intestine, especially of the colon.
name: dysentery

description: Scarring hair loss, also known as cicatricial alopecia, is the loss of hair which is accompanied with scarring. This is in contrast to non scarring hair loss.
name: cicatricial alopecia

description: Cardiofaciocutaneous (CFC) syndrome is an ectodermal dysplasia syndrome (see this term) characterized by a wide variety of manifestations including cardiac defects, distinct craniofacial features, ectodermal anomalies (most commonly dry hyperkeratotic skin and sparse, thin hair), and moderate to severe developmental delay.
name: Cardiofaciocutaneous syndrome

description: The myopathic form of carnitine palmitoyltransferase II (CPT II) deficiency, an inherited metabolic disorder that affects mitochondrial oxidation of long chain fatty acids (LCFA), is the most common and the least severe form of CPT II deficiency (see this term).
name: Carnitine palmitoyl transferase II deficiency, myopathic form

hasExactSynonym: Carnitine palmitoyl transferase deficiency type 2, myopathic form
Carnitine palmitoyl transferase deficiency type 2, adult-onset form
Carnitine palmitoyl transferase II deficiency, adult-onset form

description: 46,XX gonadal dysgenesis (46,XX GD) is a primary ovarian defect leading to premature ovarian failure (POF; see this term) in otherwise normal 46,XX females as a result of failure of the gonads to develop or due to resistance to gonadotrophin stimulation.
name: 46,XX gonadal dysgenesis

description: Neonatal intrahepatic cholestasis due to citrin deficiency is a mild subtype of citrin deficiency (see this term) characterized clinically by low birth weight, failure to thrive, growth retardation, transient intrahepatic cholestasis, multiple aminoacidemia, galactosemia, hypoproteinemia, hepatomegaly, decreased coagulation factors, hemolytic anemia, variable but mostly mild liver dysfunction, and hypoglycemia.
name: Neonatal intrahepatic cholestasis due to citrin deficiency

hasExactSynonym: Neonatal intrahepatic cholestasis caused by citrin deficiency

name: Isolated focal cortical dysplasia type IIb

description: A disease involving the lymphatic part of lymphoid system.
name: lymphatic system disease

hasExactSynonym: disorder of lymphatic part of lymphoid system
disease of lymphatic part of lymphoid system
disorder of lymph node and lymphatics
lymphatic part of lymphoid system disease or disorder
disease or disorder of lymphatic part of lymphoid system
lymphatic part of lymphoid system disease

description: Inflammation of the pleura secondary to an infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
name: pleural tuberculosis

hasExactSynonym: tuberculous pleurisy in primary progressive tuberculosis

description: quantification of the highest and/or lowest frequency of sound perceived by an individual
name: hearing threshold measurement

description: quantification of the amount of thrombomodulin in a sample
name: thrombomodulin measurement

description: waist-hip ratio that has been adjusted by subjects’ body mass index
name: BMI-adjusted waist-hip ratio

description: quantification of some aspect of nighttime rest such as duration or quality
name: nighttime rest measurement

description: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of treatment with mercaptopurine
name: response to mercaptopurine

description: quantification of the amount of carboxypeptidase B2 in a sample
name: carboxypeptidase B2 measurement
